definitions: regular sequence of activities performed in a fixed order
theatrical or entertainment performance act presented repeatedly
sequence of computer instructions designed to accomplish a specific task
examples: Her morning routine includes meditation and stretching exercises
The doctor asked about his daily routine and habits
The comedian performed his famous routine about airline travel
Their dance routine won first place in the competition
The software routine checks for errors before processing data
This maintenance routine runs automatically every midnight

definitions: thickening mixture made from flour and fat cooked together used in sauces and soups
examples: The chef prepared a dark roux for the gumbo
Make a blonde roux by cooking butter and flour gently

definitions: person who travels constantly without fixed destination
vehicle designed for exploration especially on other planets
player position in Australian football with flexible field coverage
examples: The old rover traveled from town to town seeking adventure
He lived as a rover, never staying anywhere permanently
The Mars rover collected soil samples for analysis
NASA's lunar rover explored the moon's surface successfully
The rover intercepted the ball at center field
She plays rover position for the local team

definitions: act of traveling continuously without fixed destination or purpose
continuous strand of fibers prepared for spinning into yarn
examples: His roving through Europe lasted three years
Their roving lifestyle suited their adventurous spirits perfectly
The roving must be properly aligned before spinning
She bought merino wool roving for her project

definitions: line of things or people arranged side by side
noisy argument or quarrel between people
act of propelling a boat using oars
examples: The students sat in neat rows facing the teacher
Plant the seeds in straight rows twelve inches apart
They had a terrible row about money last night
The neighbors' row could be heard through the walls
Their morning row across the lake was peaceful
We went for a row on the river yesterday

definitions: small boat designed to be propelled by oars
examples: They rented a rowboat to explore the lake
The old rowboat needed repairs before launching

definitions: person who behaves in a noisy and disorderly manner
examples: The rowdy was escorted out by security guards
A group of rowdies disrupted the peaceful gathering

definitions: person who propels a boat using oars
athlete who competes in the sport of rowing
examples: The rower guided the boat through narrow channels
An experienced rower can maintain steady rhythm effortlessly
The Olympic rower trained six hours every day
University rowers competed in the annual regatta yesterday

definitions: competitive sport involving racing boats propelled by oars
physical exercise performed on rowing machines or in boats
examples: Rowing requires tremendous upper body strength and endurance
The university rowing team practices at dawn daily
She does thirty minutes of rowing for cardio exercise
Rowing provides excellent full-body workout without joint impact

definitions: member of a monarch's family or someone with royal status
examples: The royals attended the state dinner last evening
Several European royals gathered for the wedding ceremony

definitions: person who supports or advocates for monarchical government and royal authority
examples: The royalist defended the monarchy against republican criticism
Many royalists fled during the revolutionary period

definitions: status, power, or privilege of being a monarch or royal family member
payment made to creators or owners for use of their property or work
examples: European royalty gathered for the coronation ceremony yesterday
The responsibilities of royalty include many ceremonial duties
The author receives royalty payments from book sales quarterly
Music royalty rates vary depending on streaming platforms

definitions: revolutions per minute, a measurement of rotational speed
examples: The engine runs at 3000 rpm when cruising
Increase the drill speed to 1200 rpm slowly

definitions: act of applying pressure with movement against a surface
central difficulty or problem in a situation
examples: Give the brass a good rub with polish
The massage included a therapeutic back rub
Here's the rub: we need approval before proceeding
The rub lies in finding qualified personnel quickly

definitions: elastic waterproof substance made from latex or synthetic materials
piece of rubber or similar material used for erasing marks
deciding match in a series of games or contests
examples: The tires are made from synthetic rubber compounds
Natural rubber comes from tropical tree sap
She used a rubber to erase the pencil marks
Keep a rubber handy for correcting mistakes
They played a rubber to determine the champion
The bridge rubber lasted until past midnight

definitions: action of applying pressure with movement against something
image created by placing paper over a textured surface and rubbing
examples: The constant rubbing wore through the fabric eventually
Rubbing alcohol helps clean electronic components effectively
She made a rubbing of the ancient stone carving
Brass rubbings preserve details of historical monuments

definitions: waste material or unwanted items to be discarded
ideas or statements considered worthless or untrue
examples: The rubbish bins are collected every Tuesday morning
Clear all the rubbish from the construction site
That theory is complete rubbish without scientific support
Don't believe such rubbish about the company

definitions: broken fragments of stone, brick, or concrete from demolished buildings
examples: Rescue teams searched through rubble for survivors
The earthquake reduced buildings to rubble within seconds

definitions: unsophisticated person from a rural area, often easily deceived
examples: The city slickers tried to swindle the rube
Don't act like a rube at the formal dinner

definitions: contagious viral infection causing red rash and mild fever, also called German measles
examples: The rubella vaccine prevents this dangerous childhood disease
Rubella during pregnancy can cause serious birth defects

definitions: basic monetary unit of Russia and some former Soviet states
examples: The price increased to fifty thousand rubles overnight
Exchange your dollars for rubles at the bank

definitions: scoring guide listing specific criteria for evaluating performance or work
heading or category under which something is classified
examples: The teacher provided a detailed rubric for grading essays
Students reviewed the rubric before starting their projects
This issue falls under the rubric of public safety
Various topics were discussed under the rubric of reform

definitions: precious red gemstone variety of corundum mineral
dynamic open-source programming language focused on simplicity
deep red color resembling the gemstone
examples: The ruby ring sparkled in the jeweler's display
Rubies from Myanmar are particularly valuable gemstones
She learned Ruby to develop web applications efficiently
Ruby on Rails revolutionized web development frameworks
The sunset painted the sky in ruby hues
She wore lipstick in a rich ruby shade

definitions: dense crowd or mass of people or things
wrinkle or fold in fabric or material
loose scrum formation in rugby around a tackled player
examples: A ruck of tourists blocked the museum entrance
He pushed through the ruck of commuters
Iron out the rucks in your shirt collar
The curtain fabric formed unsightly rucks
The forwards competed fiercely for possession in the ruck
Quick ball from the ruck created scoring opportunities

definitions: hinged vertical structure at the stern of a vessel used for steering
examples: The ship's rudder was damaged during the storm
Turn the rudder hard to starboard immediately

definitions: feeling of sorrow, regret, or remorse about something
bitter herb plant with yellow flowers used medicinally
examples: His rue over missed opportunities haunted him constantly
She expressed deep rue for her harsh words
Medieval healers used rue for various ailments
The garden included rue among other medicinal herbs

definitions: elaborate starched collar worn in the 16th and 17th centuries
Eurasian sandpiper bird with distinctive neck feathers during breeding
act of trumping in card games when unable to follow suit
examples: The portrait showed nobles wearing elaborate lace ruffs
Her costume included an authentic Elizabethan ruff
The male ruff displays colorful plumage during mating
Ruffs migrate through wetlands in large flocks
He won the trick with a clever ruff
A ruff and discard gave declarer the contract

definitions: violent lawless person who engages in rough or brutal behavior
examples: The ruffian threatened passersby in the dark alley
A gang of ruffians terrorized the neighborhood

definitions: thick floor covering smaller than carpet, often decorative
examples: The Persian rug added warmth to the living room
She placed a small rug beside her bed

definitions: team sport played with oval ball involving running, passing, and physical tackling
examples: Rugby requires both strength and strategic thinking skills
The rugby match attracted thousands of passionate fans

definitions: physical remains of a destroyed or decayed building or structure
state of complete destruction or disintegration
complete loss of money, social position, or reputation
examples: Ancient ruins attract millions of tourists each year
The castle ruins overlooked the valley below
The storm left the coastal town in complete ruin
Years of neglect brought the mansion to ruin
Bad investments led to his financial ruin
The scandal meant political ruin for several officials

definitions: act or process of causing complete destruction or downfall
examples: The constant flooding is ruining the foundation slowly
His reckless spending was ruining the family finances

definitions: prescribed guide for conduct or action that must be followed
period of governing authority or control over a territory
straight measuring device marked with units of measurement
examples: School rules prohibit running in the hallways
The new rule requires all employees to sign in
British rule in India lasted nearly two centuries
The king's rule brought peace and prosperity
Use a rule to draw straight lines accurately
The carpenter's rule showed precise measurements

definitions: straight strip of wood, plastic, or metal marked with measuring units
person who governs or has authority over a country or territory
examples: She used a ruler to underline important sentences
The ruler showed the paper was exactly twelve inches
The ruler decreed new laws for the kingdom
Ancient rulers built monuments to display their power

definitions: position, period, or quality of being a ruler with governing authority
examples: His rulership lasted twenty years of prosperity
The transition of rulership occurred peacefully

definitions: official decision made by a judge or court of law
act of governing or exercising authority over others
examples: The court's ruling favored the plaintiff completely
They awaited the judge's ruling on the motion
His ruling of the province proved remarkably effective
The ruling elite controlled all major resources

definitions: alcoholic spirit distilled from sugarcane byproducts or molasses
examples: Caribbean rum has distinctive flavor from local molasses
The pirates' rum supply lasted through the voyage

definitions: ballroom dance of Cuban origin with distinctive hip movements
rhythmic music genre originating in Cuba with African influences
examples: They performed an elegant rumba at the competition
Learning rumba requires mastering specific hip movements
The band played traditional Cuban rumba all night
Rumba music features complex percussion patterns

definitions: deep continuous rolling sound like distant thunder
gang fight or violent confrontation between groups
examples: Thunder's rumble echoed across the valley continuously
The rumble of trucks disturbed residents nightly
The rumble between rival gangs lasted until dawn
Police prevented a rumble outside the stadium

definitions: deep continuous rolling or gurgling sound
early signs or indications of discontent or trouble
examples: The rumbling of the volcano warned of eruption
Stomach rumbling indicated she needed lunch soon
Political rumblings suggested an upcoming leadership change
There were rumblings of dissatisfaction among employees

definitions: deep or careful consideration of something over time
process by which ruminant animals rechew partially digested food
examples: His rumination on the problem yielded innovative solutions
After much rumination, she decided to accept
Cattle rumination helps break down tough plant fibers
The cow's rumination process takes several hours daily

definitions: card game where players form sets and sequences of cards
examples: They played rummy every Friday night together
Gin rummy requires strategy and memory skills

definitions: unverified information or story circulating from person to person
examples: The rumor about layoffs spread through the office
Don't believe every rumor you hear online

definitions: unverified information or story circulating from person to person
examples: The rumour about the merger proved completely false
Rumours circulated about the celebrity's secret wedding

definitions: hind part of a mammal, especially the buttocks
small remaining part or remnant of something larger
examples: The horse's rump showed its powerful muscles
Rump steak comes from the animal's hindquarters
Only a rump of the original committee remains
The rump parliament continued meeting despite opposition

definitions: continuous period or spell of a specified condition or activity
score in baseball made by completing a circuit of bases
continuous series of performances or productions
examples: The team's winning run lasted twelve games
We had a good run of sunny weather
He scored three runs in yesterday's game
The home run brought in two additional runs
The play's run on Broadway lasted five years
This production run will produce ten thousand units

definitions: small car or aircraft designed for short trips
small motorboat used for short pleasure trips
examples: The compact runabout was perfect for city driving
They bought a runabout for weekend errands
Their runabout could accommodate six passengers comfortably
The marina rented runabouts to tourists hourly

definitions: person, especially a young person, who has run away from home
situation or process that becomes uncontrolled or exceeds limits
examples: The shelter provides services for teenage runaways
Police found the runaway at the bus station
Runaway inflation devastated the country's economy
The project became a runaway success beyond expectations

definitions: brief summary or analysis of a situation or information
state of being in poor condition through neglect
examples: Give me a quick rundown of today's meetings
The detective provided a rundown of the evidence
The rundown apartment building needed extensive repairs
Years of rundown left the facility barely functional

definitions: character from ancient Germanic alphabets used before Latin script
symbol believed to have magical or mystical significance
examples: Viking runes were carved into stone monuments
Scholars study runes to understand ancient texts
The fortune teller cast runes to predict futures
Fantasy games often feature magical runes
